SEARCH
Package com.domino.app.view

Class DominoViewImp

java.lang.Object
com.domino.app.view.DominoViewImp
All Implemented Interfaces:
DominoView
public class DominoViewImp extends Object implements DominoView
The implementation of the DominoView interface. This class handles the presentation layer of the Domino game, providing methods to display game information, player actions, and game status updates to the console.

    Creates a new instance of DominoViewImp.

  • Constructor Details

    • DominoViewImp

      public DominoViewImp()
      Creates a new instance of DominoViewImp. This constructor sets up the initial state of the view, including the last move and controller references, and initializes the summary joiner for output formatting.

    • booleanToOption

      public String booleanToOption(boolean option)
      Converts a boolean option to its string representation.
      Parameters:
      option - the boolean value to convert
      Returns:
      "HIDDEN" if option is true, otherwise "VISIBLE"

    • displayPlayersPoints

      public void displayPlayersPoints()
      Displays the points of all players in the console.

    • displayHiddenBoneyardTiles

      public void displayHiddenBoneyardTiles()
      Displays the tiles in the boneyard. If the option to hide boneyard tiles is enabled, the representation will be hidden; otherwise, it will show the regular representation.

    • displayVisibleBoneyardTiles

      public void displayVisibleBoneyardTiles()
      Displays the tiles in the boneyard without any restrictions. This method shows the regular representation of the boneyard tiles, regardless of the visibility options set by the user.

    • displayBoardLastMove

      public void displayBoardLastMove()
      Displays the last move made on the board. If the board is not empty, it will print the last move along with separators for clarity.

    • displayHiddenPlayerTiles

      public void displayHiddenPlayerTiles()
      Displays the tiles of all players, hiding opponent tiles if the option is enabled. Only shows the tiles of the current player.

    • displayVisiblePlayerTiles

      public void displayVisiblePlayerTiles()
      Displays the tiles of all players, showing all tiles regardless of the player's turn.

    • displayPlayerTiles

      public void displayPlayerTiles(IntPredicate showTilesCondition)
      Displays the tiles of players while considering visibility rules. The method chooses to display the tiles of players based on the provided condition.
      Parameters:
      showTilesCondition - A predicate that determines whether to show the tiles of a player.
